name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Surface on which asphalt is to be placed is essentially dry and free from surface water. All manhole and valve covers have been raised or lowered to the new surface level of the pavement.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Vicroads std sec 407.14, AS2150 10.1
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Asphalt shall not be placed if the majority of the surface area is below:
○ Base & Intermediate Courses: 5°C for conventional binders or 10°C for PMBs & Class 600
○ Wearing Courses: 10°C for conventional binders or 15°C for PMBs.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The area to be paved is free of all loose and deleterious material
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Vicroads std sec 407.14, AS2150 10.3

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Tack coat to be sprayed in a uniform ﬁlm over the surface area at a rate of 0.15-0.30 L/m2 of residual binder (60% bitumen). This rate is to be doubled on joints and chases. Tack coat must be allowed to turn from brown to black before paving. NOTE: Tack coat is not required on clean, freshly placed asphalt or primed surfaces or when the layer to be placed exceeds 50mm unless directed by the Client
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Vicroads std sec 407.15, AS2150 11

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A site speciﬁc paving plan shall be generated by the contractor prior to asphalt commencement to adhere to the following: Transverse Joints: Oﬀset from layer to layer by at least 2m Longitudinal Joints: Oﬀset from layer to layer by at least 150mm and be within 300mm of the lane line or centre of lane. Wearing course shall be on lane lines. Where new pavement abuts an existing pavement, the existing pavement shall be removed in steps to achieve an oﬀset from layer to layer of not less than 150mm.
METHOD: Measure and mark out runs and submit Paving Plan to Client if requested

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The placement of asphalt on the sub- base or granular base for a new pavement or for an overlay of an existing bituminous surfaced pavement shall not commence until the consent to proceed is obtained from the Vicroads Superintendent.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Asphalt is not segregated, binder is not separated or does not contain uncoated particles and the temperature from mixing plant is not more than 175°C.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VcRoads Std Specs 407.16, Table 407.081
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ability to locate asphalt test results placed in three dimensions i.e. start/end chainage, oﬀset/lane and layer
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Fulton Hogan Quality Plan
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Thickness of asphalt layer conforms to asphalt thickness on drawings or speciﬁcations
METHOD: Dips, string line, measurements oﬀ kerb
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A transverse joint shall be constructed if the asphalt in front of the screed cools to below 120°C
Asphalt should be ramped down by constructing a temporary wedge of dense graded or cold mixed asphalt. Max ramp grade:
FREQUENCY: During paving and after ﬁnal roll
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The ﬁnished surface of asphalt wearing course shall be of uniform appearance, free of dragged areas, cracks, open textured patches and roller marks
FREQUENCY: During paving and after ﬁnal roll
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The edge of the wearing course shall be either ﬂush with or not more than 5 mm above the lip of the channel unless otherwise speciﬁed
2.10 - Alignment of layers not placed against concrete edge
FREQUENCY: During paving and at completion of work

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The edge of asphalt layers shall not be more than 50mm inside nor more than 100mm outside, the designed oﬀset from centreline or design line. The rate of change of oﬀset of the edge of layer shall not be greater than 25mm in 10m
METHOD: Alignment as marked by Surveyor and measured
RESPONSIBILITY: Client Surveyor, Project Engineer, Site Supervisor
2.11 - Width of layers not placed against concrete edge
FREQUENCY: During paving and at completion of work
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The width of asphalt layers shall not be less than the design or speciﬁed width of layer by more than 50mm or greater than the design or speciﬁed width by more than 100mm.
2.12 - Traﬃcking of Asphalt & Paving of multiple layers
FREQUENCY: During paving and at completion of work
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Traﬃcking of asphalt or placement of asphalt over freshly laid asphalt layer is not permitted unless the majority of the asphalt has a surface temperature lower than 50°C
METHOD: Measurement or suﬃcient time has lapsed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: For layers <50mm, if characteristic density ratio is:
○ 94.9% to 93.0% Lot may be accepted at reduced rate
○ 92.9% or less Remove and replace asphalt
For layers ≥50mm, if characteristic thickness is:
○ 95.0% to 94.0% Lot may be accepted at reduced rate.
○ 93.9% or less Remove and replace asphalt
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Vicroads std sec Table 407.221
RESPONSIBILITY: Fulton Hogan Laboratory Technician Veriﬁed by Project Engineer
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Individual departures from design not to exceed ±5mm with a standard deviation of no greater than 8mm (Scale A)
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Vicroads std sec Table 407.222
RESPONSIBILITY: External Surveyor Project Engineer to verify
The signature below veriﬁes that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and veriﬁes lot compliance with speciﬁcations.
